title: Build Sequence: PRD-001 (Part 7 of 8)
buildPhilosophy: Generated using vertical-slice strategy. Each FBS represents a testable, deployable increment.

buildSequence.title: Manual Job Entry Form
buildSequence.summary: Delivers a comprehensive manual job entry form with validation and field organization. Enables users to manually add job opportunities when automated scraping is not available or suitable.
testableOutcomes: User can access manual job entry form by clicking 'Add Job Manually' button from job discovery page
Form displays all required fields: job title (200 chars), company name (100 chars), job description (5000 chars), requirements (3000 chars), salary range, location (100 chars), and remote status
Form displays optional fields: job URL and application deadline with proper validation
System validates required fields and shows error messages when fields are empty or exceed character limits
System validates URL format in job URL field and shows error for invalid URLs
System validates salary values and rejects negative numbers or non-numeric text
System validates deadline dates and only accepts today or future dates
Character count warnings appear when approaching field limits and prevent exceeding limits
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Focus on comprehensive form validation and user experience. Ensure character limits are enforced client-side with server-side validation backup. Consider accessibility requirements for form fields and error messaging.

buildSequence.title: Manual Job Entry Integration
buildSequence.summary: Integrates manual job entry with existing job processing pipeline including matching, tracking, and content generation. Ensures manually entered jobs receive full system functionality.
testableOutcomes: User can successfully submit completed manual job form and receive confirmation message
System prevents submission when required fields are missing and shows validation errors
Successfully submitted jobs receive unique identifier and timestamp
User is redirected to job details view or job list after successful submission
Manually entered jobs appear in matching algorithm results with compatibility scores
Manually entered jobs are available as targets for cover letter generation
Generated cover letters use job title, company, description, and requirements from manual entry
Manually entered jobs appear in application tracking dashboard alongside scraped jobs
Application status updates work correctly for manually entered jobs
Jobs with deadlines show appropriate deadline highlighting in tracking dashboard
Jobs with URLs allow clickable navigation to original posting

deliverables: Database migration for manual job source tracking

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Ensure manual jobs integrate seamlessly with existing pipeline. Pay attention to data consistency and proper source attribution. Test all downstream services with manually entered job data.

buildSequence.title: Multiple CV Variants System
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive CV variant management allowing users to create, parse, and manage multiple CV versions with independent skill profiles. Enables targeted job matching using different professional presentations.
testableOutcomes: User can create new CV variant with unique name and upload PDF, DOC, or DOCX files
System prevents duplicate variant names and shows error for name conflicts
First created variant automatically becomes default variant
Each uploaded CV variant is independently parsed into separate skill profile
Skill profiles remain isolated with no cross-variant contamination
Failed parsing shows error message with retry option
Re-parsing updated variant only affects that variant's skill profile
User can select specific CV variant from dropdown when viewing job postings
Match calculations use only skills and experience from selected variant
System clearly indicates which variant was used for matching analysis
Changing selected variant triggers recalculation with new variant data
Single variant automatically selected without dropdown display
User can designate default variant for automated matching in settings
Automated job matching uses default variant's skill profile
Default variant is clearly marked in profile settings
Deleting current default variant automatically sets next available as default

deliverables: Database migration for cv_variants and skill_profiles tables
Enhanced matching service with variant selection

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Critical to maintain skill profile isolation between variants. Ensure parsing pipeline can handle multiple variants without interference. Consider storage implications for multiple CV files per user. Test default variant logic thoroughly, especially edge cases around deletion.

buildSequence.title: CV Variant Management
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive CV variant management allowing users to update, rename, and delete individual CV variants independently. Provides safeguards for default variant management and prevents deletion of the last remaining variant.
testableOutcomes: User can edit variant name, upload new file, and modify settings for specific CV variant without affecting other variants
System re-parses only the updated variant's skill profile when file is changed, leaving other variants unchanged
System prevents deletion of the last remaining CV variant with error message 'At least one CV variant is required'
System automatically assigns new default variant when current default variant is deleted
System displays confirmation dialog with warning about losing application history before deleting variant with associated data
Variant name changes are immediately reflected in all dropdown menus and selection lists across the application
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Requires careful handling of file uploads, skill profile re-parsing, and cascade deletion logic. Must ensure atomic operations for variant updates and proper cleanup of associated data.

buildSequence.title: Match Preference Customization
buildSequence.summary: Delivers comprehensive match preference customization system allowing users to set custom weights for different matching dimensions, apply predefined presets, and save preferences to their profile. Implements weighted scoring algorithm that uses personalized preferences.
testableOutcomes: User can adjust preference weights using sliders for skills match, remote work, salary range, company size, industry, and experience level
System automatically normalizes weights to sum to 100% when total exceeds 100%
System displays validation errors and prevents saving when negative or non-numeric weight values are entered
User can select 'Remote Priority' preset which sets remote work weight to 40% and distributes other dimensions with lower weights
User can select 'Salary Priority' preset which sets salary range weight to 40% and distributes other dimensions appropriately
User can select 'Skills Match Priority' preset which sets skills match weight to 50% and distributes remaining dimensions
System saves custom preference weights to user profile and persists across sessions
Job match scores are calculated using saved preference weights with each dimension score multiplied by its corresponding weight
Jobs with high scores in user's high-weight preferences rank higher than jobs with high scores in low-weight preferences
System recalculates all match scores when user updates and saves new preference weights
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Complex integration with existing hybrid scoring algorithm. Requires careful weight normalization logic and efficient recalculation of match scores. Must handle preset application and custom weight validation properly.

buildSequence.title: Preference Impact Visualization
buildSequence.summary: Provides detailed visualization of how user preference weights affect individual job match scores. Shows breakdown of raw scores, weighted contributions, and total match score calculations to help users understand and optimize their preferences.
testableOutcomes: User can expand match details for any job to see breakdown of scores for each dimension (skills, remote, salary, company size, industry, experience level)
Match breakdown displays both raw score and weighted score contribution for each dimension
Jobs with high remote work scores show high weighted contribution when user has set high remote work preference weight
User can compare same job's match breakdown before and after preference changes to see how weighted scores and total changed
Match score visualization clearly shows which dimensions contribute most to the final score based on user's preference weights
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Primarily UI-focused with data visualization components. Requires integration with existing match scoring system to retrieve detailed score breakdowns. Should include responsive design for mobile viewing.

buildSequence.title: Content Editing & Versioning
buildSequence.summary: Implements rich text editing capabilities for cover letters and CVs with automatic version creation on save. Users can edit generated content with formatting controls and maintain complete version history with job associations.
testableOutcomes: User can click edit button on generated cover letter and rich text editor opens with current content loaded
User can apply bold, italic, and underline formatting to selected text in the editor
User can create paragraphs and line breaks that are preserved in the content structure
User can edit different CV sections (summary, experience, skills) with changes applied to respective sections
User can rearrange CV section order and the new order is preserved when saved
System automatically creates new version with incremented number when user saves edited content
System preserves previous versions unchanged and accessible after creating new version
System creates version 1.0 as original generated content and version 1.1 as first user edit
System automatically links initial generated content version to the specific job it was created for
System maintains job link when user saves edited versions for the same job application
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Rich text editor requires careful handling of formatting preservation and version diff tracking. Version management must maintain referential integrity with job associations.

buildSequence.title: Version Management & Export
buildSequence.summary: Provides comprehensive version history management with comparison tools and export capabilities. Users can view version history, compare versions side-by-side, revert to previous versions, and export content as plain text.
testableOutcomes: User can click version history and see chronological list of all versions ordered newest to oldest
User can view version entry showing version number, creation date, and associated job information
User can click on specific version and view the full content of that version
User can select two versions and open side-by-side comparison view with differences highlighted
User can see added content highlighted in green and removed content highlighted in red in comparison
User can select previous version and click revert to open confirmation dialog
User can confirm revert action and selected version becomes current active version with new version created
User can click export button and see option to export content as plain text format
User can complete plain text export and receive .txt file with formatting removed but structure preserved
System prevents revert when user cancels confirmation dialog and returns to version history unchanged
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Version comparison requires efficient diff algorithms for large content. Export functionality must handle various formatting edge cases and maintain readability.

buildSequence.title: Application Status Management
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive application status management with metadata capture, automatic Kanban board updates, and follow-up reminder scheduling. Users can mark jobs as applied with CV and cover letter tracking, and manually change status across all workflow states.
testableOutcomes: User can click 'Mark as Applied' button and job status changes to 'Applied' with metadata modal opening
User can select CV variant and cover letter version from available options in application metadata form
User can submit application metadata form with application date automatically set to today's date
User can cancel metadata form and job status remains unchanged from original state
System automatically moves job from any column to 'Applied' column when marked as applied
System updates 'Applied' column job count correctly when jobs move to applied status
System automatically schedules follow-up reminder when job is marked as applied
User can view scheduled reminder date in job details after marking job as applied
User can select 'Change Status' and see all workflow options: Bookmarked, Applied, Interviewing, Offered, Rejected, Withdrawn
User can change status to any workflow state and job moves to appropriate Kanban column
System creates independent follow-up reminders for multiple jobs marked as applied on same day
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Status workflow management requires careful validation of state transitions and integration with reminder scheduling. Kanban board updates must handle concurrent status changes gracefully.

buildSequence.title: Status Change Validation & Error Handling
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive validation for job application status changes with error handling, network failure recovery, and concurrent request management. Ensures data integrity and provides clear user feedback for all status change scenarios.
testableOutcomes: Status remains unchanged and error message displays when network error occurs during status update
Validation errors prevent status change to 'Applied' when required metadata fields are missing
Clear error message explains invalid transition when user attempts unsupported status change
Second status change request is queued or blocked when first request is still processing
Confirmation message displays new status when status change completes successfully

deliverables: Enhanced status update API endpoints with validation

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Focus on robust validation logic and graceful error handling. Implement request queuing to prevent concurrent status changes. Ensure all error messages are user-friendly and actionable.
